description.b: This cheat sheet is to test the SDA printing feature of plots and images.

item.title: Open a data file in its corresponding editor
item.description: Please follow the steps below to test the print feature.

subitem.label: 1. Open in the project explorer the file '/SRS/i16-SCAN/76003.dat' using 'right-click/Open With/SRS Editor'.
2. Select one of the preferred data set to have the plotting refreshed.
3. On the Dataset Plot View, click on the Printer button on the tool bar or on the menu located on the top right hand corner of that same view
4. If the Dataset Plot View is active you can also use the main menu/tool bar Print Button or the short key CTRL+P.
5. On the new Preview dialog displayed, you can select the scale (10% to 100%), the resolution/quality of the plot and the printer to use.
6. Once the characteristics of the printing are chosen click on Select Printer/Print or Print button if your preferred printer is already the one by default.
7. Try the previous steps with another plot/image and other printing characteristics.

8. The chosen print settings are kept in memory and the last settings used will be chosen once a new instance of the preview dialog is open. You can also change those settings from the general preference page by going to 'Window/Preferences/SDA/Plot Printing Settings'.
